marklogic.body: Its too bad he's seems so cynical and disappointed about Soul Coughing's history; kind of a shame he doesn't realize or appreciate how innovative and unique their sound/style really was. I guess its easy to say being not he outside looking in, though. I was fortunate enough to see them a couple of times in Atlanta and they were an amazing live band earlier in their career. By the time El Oso came around, you could tell it was wearing on the band, but their first two records are really great and I will Always look back on them fondly.
